item.content:encoded: @aakashweb Whoa! This is interesting. Didn’t know this #WordPress plugin exists before. Would have given it a spin had I learned sooner.

item.title: Git it Write – Write posts from GitHub – WordPress plugin
item.description:
Git it Write – Write posts from GitHub – WordPress plugin

Publish markdown files present in a GitHub repository as posts to WordPress automatically

Git it Write allows to publish the markdown files present in a GitHub repository to your WordPress site. So with this plugin, whenever the files are added, updated in the repository the WordPress post will be added, updated accordingly.
item.content:encoded:
Git it Write – Write posts from GitHub – WordPress plugin

Publish markdown files present in a GitHub repository as posts to WordPress automatically

Git it Write allows to publish the markdown files present in a GitHub repository to your WordPress site. So with this plugin, whenever the files are added, updated in the repository the WordPress post will be added, updated accordingly.

Interesting. I just discovered this today. Would have already taken it to a spin had I learned it sooner.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JHAA0FNFDS9CV8SY8GDPV4BC
item.description: I think I’m done with #WordPress. The drama never stops. Besides, I’m really starting to loving Hugo, and if coupled with #Python and some bash scripts, I think they are perfect #GoHugo
item.content:encoded: I think I’m done with #WordPress. The drama never stops. Besides, I’m really starting to loving Hugo, and if coupled with #Python and some bash scripts, I think they are perfect #GoHugo

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JH9YJH27Q8TR3XQ47RGKFGQF
item.description: I’ve been passionate about photography for over 20 years now. Back in 2006, I invested in my first (and only) #DSLR, the #Canon EOS 30D, and went all-in, eventually spending over half a million pesos on lenses and gear. Fast forward to today, and that once-prized collection is now gathering dust in my closet. The rise of smartphone photography and the flood of enthusiasts in the field have slowly pushed my DSLR into early retirement. Half a million pesos, just sitting there—talk about an expensive display of nostalgia!
item.content:encoded: I’ve been passionate about photography for over 20 years now. Back in 2006, I invested in my first (and only) #DSLR, the #Canon EOS 30D, and went all-in, eventually spending over half a million pesos on lenses and gear. Fast forward to today, and that once-prized collection is now gathering dust in my closet. The rise of smartphone photography and the flood of enthusiasts in the field have slowly pushed my DSLR into early retirement. Half a million pesos, just sitting there—talk about an expensive display of nostalgia!

item.title: Using Beszel to monitor Windows
item.description:
Using Beszel to monitor Windows

Beszel is a new, lightweight monitoring app that natively supports Mac and Linux. I’ll cover how to set it up natively in Windows or WSL2 in today’s post.
This is one app I really wanted to get up and running to monitor my systems. Unfortunately, my first attempt didn’t go as planned.
item.content:encoded:
Using Beszel to monitor Windows

Beszel is a new, lightweight monitoring app that natively supports Mac and Linux. I’ll cover how to set it up natively in Windows or WSL2 in today’s post.
This is one app I really wanted to get up and running to monitor my systems. Unfortunately, my first attempt didn’t go as planned.

item.title: Sink URL Shortener
item.description:
Sink URL Shortener

A simple, speedy, and secure link shortener with analytics, 100% run on Cloudflare.

About 2 years ago, I’ve been looking for a good self-hosted URL shortener/Bitly alternative. YOURLS was the only one around. Nowadays, we’ll never run out of alternatives.

This one looks sleek though, and can be run on Cloudflare.
item.content:encoded:
Sink URL Shortener

A simple, speedy, and secure link shortener with analytics, 100% run on Cloudflare.

About 2 years ago, I’ve been looking for a good self-hosted URL shortener/Bitly alternative. YOURLS was the only one around. Nowadays, we’ll never run out of alternatives.

This one looks sleek though, and can be run on Cloudflare.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JH8GAADG9ASZ59959T5Q7FR6
item.description:
#CaddyGen is a user-friendly web interface for generating #Caddy server configurations. github.com/∞

I thought the UI makes you manage various caddy configurations for different domains/subdomains in your server. I thought I can retire now my little #UpCaddy project: github.com/∞

No, the UI is for generating caddy configurations based on presets.
item.content:encoded:
#CaddyGen is a user-friendly web interface for generating #Caddy server configurations. github.com/∞

I thought the UI makes you manage various caddy configurations for different domains/subdomains in your server. I thought I can retire now my little #UpCaddy project: github.com/∞

No, the UI is for generating caddy configurations based on presets.

item.title: CaddyGen - Caddy Config Generator
item.description:
CaddyGen - Caddy Config Generator

CaddyGen is a user-friendly web interface for generating Caddy server configurations. Easily create and manage reverse proxy and file server configurations with support for SSL, compression, security headers, and more.
This is a Caddy config generator based on presets. No, the UI is not about managing your various Caddy configurations.
item.content:encoded:
CaddyGen - Caddy Config Generator

CaddyGen is a user-friendly web interface for generating Caddy server configurations. Easily create and manage reverse proxy and file server configurations with support for SSL, compression, security headers, and more.
This is a Caddy config generator based on presets. No, the UI is not about managing your various Caddy configurations.
